metadata.description:
I was sitting in a rented Tesla waiting for it to charge when the young homie, CUBE random sent me this instrumental with these crazy chords. I played it on repeat until the car was charged. For some reason, the track reminded me of girls from philly. The title "Pretty Brown Jawn" with its respective chorus came to me as natural as breath. 

	In my mind I imagined a brown-skinned woman minding her business in a cafe, sipping her coffee & me working up the confidence to talk to her. In real life, Iâ€™m not that smooth but i can make you laugh if I'm nervous enough. I decided to display some of my sense of humor in the 2nd verse. 

	This track features production from a 17-year prodigy who goes by the name of "CUBE", a Dreamsoulja turned friend and collaborator. Jermaine Paul deserves flowers and chocolate for his outstanding work on bass. The vibe of this sound definitely calls back to the Soulquarians and the Electric Lady Studios sound.

lyrics.text:
Excuse me. Do you mind if I ask you a few personal questions? Ok
So tell me what you want, pretty brown jawn
What do you want in a man? 
Baby, I stand a chance? (P.B.J.)
So tell me what you want, pretty brown jawn
What do you want in a man?
Maybe I deserve a chance (P.B.J)

Word on the block, you're the talk of the town
They must be jelly the way their jam don't make that sound
I'm lovin' the way you walk, keep walkin' around
Oh and you're hot like a cup of mocha
And such a nice shade of brown
So tell me, are you looking for somebody?
Not just anybody?
I promise you'll never find another nigga like me
See, me? I would paint your world for free
But don't ask me the color of anything
'Cause all I see is your sweet brown mahogany

So tell me what you want, pretty brown jawn
What do you want in a man? 
Baby, I stand a chance? (P.B.J.)
So tell me what you want, pretty brown jawn
What do you want in a man?
Maybe I deserve a chance (P.B.J)

Ooh and you smell good
Is that The Noir?
Is that Bell Hooks?
Damn, you read books?
So you ain't dumb
Though I can't say I know all about love
But I'm hungry for a little can you save some
If you like mine we can make some
It's not like I can't, I'm patient
But I just need a little affirmation
No I can't take her home (to my granny, yeah)
If she can't use my comb (I wanna hear a sound when you pick it out girl)
Girl the way you fluff your fro 
Oh it makes me wanna share a few kinks of my own

So tell me what you want, pretty brown jawn
What do you want in a man? 
Baby, I stand a chance? (P.B.J.)
So tell me what you want, pretty brown jawn
What do you want in a man?
Maybe I deserve a chance (P.B.J)

It's okay if you decline
'Cause in my dreams you are mine
Everything I could ever want
You must be the one (two, three, four)

So tell me what you want, pretty brown jawn
What do you want in a man? 
Baby, I stand a chance? (P.B.J.)
So tell me what you want, pretty brown jawn
What do you want in a man?
Maybe I deserve a chance (P.B.J)

metadata.name: P.B.J. #1
metadata.title: P.B.J.
